lexUnit.name: grate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make an unpleasant rasping sound.

sentence.text: ` I could demonstrate , right now , " he grated .
` Get out of Venice , " he grated .
` Well , I am now going to amaze Sir Richard Springall , " Cranston grated .
` I ca n't ! " he grated harshly .
` Then pretend this is Ryan , " he grated savagely .
` Why not ? " he grated , ramming his knuckles down on the desk .
` Do not believe that for one second , " he grated .
` I am never annoyed with my mother , " he grated .
` Well , you sure as hell backed me up ! " he grated , hell-bent on a fight , she would swear ; something was eating away at him anyway .
` Is this really to do with your partnership , " he grated , ` or are you just afraid of failure once again ? "
` One day , " Cranston grated , ` I 'll see that bastard hang ! "
The only basis we have is mutual desire , " he grated out .
He 's a thief , Hilary , " he grated almost savagely .
` What , Hilary ? " he grated roughly as he gave her a little shake .
` Banker , " he grated tightly through his teeth .
` I do n't like him , " Southgate grated as soon as the monks left .
` Do n't use your brother 's name to save your neck , " he grated in a voice she barely recognised .
` Keep going , madam , " he grated through set lips .
